Docs.param: The zero-based index of the property value.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets the property value that is located at a specified index of this collection.
Docs.value: The property value at the specified index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In C#, this property is the indexer for the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.PropertyValueCollection> class.
In JScript, you can use the default indexed properties defined by a type, but you cannot explicitly define your own. However, specifying the expando attribute on a class automatically provides a default indexed property whose type is Object and whose index type is <xref:System.String>.

Docs.exception: The property value is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
The index is less than zero (0) or greater than the size of the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public object Value { get; set; }
.property instance object Value
Public Property Value As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Value { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };
member this.Value : obj with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the values of the collection.
Docs.value:
If the collection is empty, the property value is a null reference ( in Visual Basic). If the collection contains one value, the property value is that value. If the collection contains multiple values, the property value equals a copy of an array of those values.
If setting this property, the value or values are added to the . Setting this property to a null reference () clears the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To add multiple values, set this property to an array of the values.

Docs.permission: is performed when an application sets this property if the is .
